Description: Rim sherd of Chian, possibly Mature Animal Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of lotus flower in added white outline with added red centre; top of rim glazed; exterior: broken maeander pattern between brown lines.
Curator's comments: According to Lemos, the sherd belongs in the Chalice Style. However, if it does belong with British Museum 1924,1201.555 then it would be more appropriately placed within the Mature Animal Style, since some of the filling ornament on 1924,1201.555 is inconsistent with the Chalice Style. Lemos places 1924,1201.555 within the Wild Goat Style, but the interior decoration is inconsistent with this early style. However, she may be describing a different sherd, as she mentions an incised inscription on its surface, of which there is no evidence on 1924,1201.555. For parallels, see also Cambridge Museum of Classical Archaeology NA66.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 290, no. 880)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0549) (phase 2)
